title: 307. Thinking Is Expensive. Who’s Supposed to Pay for It?
description: Corporations and rich people donate billions to their favorite think tanks and foundations. Should we be grateful for their generosity — or suspicious of their motives?
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: Corporations and rich people donate billions to their favorite think tanks and foundations. Should we be grateful for their generosity — or suspicious of their motives?
